clinical_study.brief_title: IndoProCaf Effervescent Tablets Effectiveness in Acute Treatment of Migraine and/or Episodic Tension-type Headache and Patients' Satisfaction With the Treatment in Routine Clinical Practice
clinical_study.official_title: IndoProCaf (Difmetre®) Effervescent Tablets Effectiveness in Acute Treatment of Primary Headaches (Migraine and/or Episodic Tension-type Headache) and Patients' Satisfaction With the Treatment in Routine Clinical Practice in Ukraine and Kazakhstan

brief_summary.textblock: Headaches are a common medical problem that physicians frequently encounter in their practice. One of key findings of The Atlas of Headache Disorders prepared by World Health Organization (WHO) is: headache disorders, including migraine and tension-type headache (TTH), are among the most prevalent disorders of mankind. The fixed combination of indomethacin, prochlorperazine and caffeine (IndoProCaf) showed efficacy and safety in acute treatment of migraine and episodic tension-type headache attacks. IndoProCaf (Difmetre®) is widely used in common daily practice only in Italy from early 1970s, is available at the Commonwealth of Independent States (CIS) pharmaceutical market now. There are limited data regarding IndoProCaf usage from post-marketing settings. This will be a first post-marketing observational study which aimed to evaluate the effectiveness and patients' satisfaction of primary headaches acute treatment in routine clinical settings in Ukraine and Kazakhstan.

detailed_description.textblock: The study is designed as a prospective, multicentre, observational, non-interventional, non-randomized, non-controlled, single arm, post-marketing study where IndoProCaf will be prescribed in the usual manner per standard clinical practice of the treating physician and in accordance with the terms of the locally approved instruction for medical use. No additional procedures (other than the standard of care) shall be applied to the patients.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction
primary_outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Are Satisfied With IndoProCaf Treatment
primary_outcome.description: Patients are asked to evaluate their satisfaction with headache pain reduction after treatment by selecting the options: =very poor, =poor, =no opinion, =good, =very good. The satisfied patients are defined as those with =good and = very good answers.

secondary_outcome.description: Time to significant pain reduction at 1, 2, 4, 6 and 24 hours post-dose period are summarized with number of patients in each category; significant pain reduction is defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of First Dose no Response
secondary_outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of Headache Relapse
secondary_outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Patients Who Are Satisfied With Different Medicines Previously Used for Headache Attack
secondary_outcome.description: Defined as good and very good by Likert-type scale (e.g. very poor, poor, no opinion, good, very good)

arm_group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

study_pop.textblock: Patients with migraine (with or without aura) and/or episodic TTH

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Diagnosis of primary headache (migraine with or without aura and/or episodic TTH) and whose headache attacks required acute pharmacological treatment.
- Were administered IndoProCaf (Difmetre®) effervescent tablets therapy according to the local product labelling.
- Adults 18 years and older (male, female).
- Provide Authorization to the investigator to use and/or disclose personal and/or health data.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Meet contraindications for treatment with IndoProCaf (Difmetre®) effervescent tablets as outlined in the latest version of local product labelling.
- Patients who are required prescription by physician of IndoProCaf and nonsteroidal anti-inflammatory drug-containing products at the same time for acute headache attacks treatment.
- Previous discontinuation of IndoProCaf treatment due to safety (i.e. hypersensitivity) events, lack of efficacy.
- Female patients who are pregnant or are breast-feeding.

group.title: Primary Headaches
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

baseline.population: Safety set included all enrolled patients who have taken at least one dose of IndoProCaf

group.title: Primary Headaches
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction
outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
outcome.population: Number of patients in full analysis set. Full analysis set included all patients who signed informed consent and complied with all the inclusion and exclusion criteria and who had at least one acceptable headache attack treated with IndoProCaf documented in the patient’s diary. This population was used for the effectiveness endpoints reporting.

group.title: Significant Pain Reduction at 1 Hour Post Dose
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and achieved significant pain reduction at 1 hour post dose

group.title: Significant Pain Reduction at 2 Hours Post Dose
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and achieved significant pain reduction at 2 hours post dose

group.title: Significant Pain Reduction at 4 Hour Post Dose
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and achieved significant pain reduction at 4 hours post dose

group.title: Significant Pain Reduction at 6 Hours Post Dose
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and achieved significant pain reduction at 6 hours post dose

group.title: Significant Pain Reduction at 24 Hours Post Dose
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and achieved significant pain reduction at 24 hours post dose

measure.title: Time to Significant Pain Reduction
measure.description: Time to significant pain reduction at 1, 2, 4, 6 and 24 hours post-dose period are summarized with number of patients in each category; significant pain reduction is defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
measure.population: Number of patients in full analysis set. Full analysis set included all patients who signed informed consent and complied with all the inclusion and exclusion criteria and who had at least one acceptable headache attack treated with IndoProCaf documented in the patient’s diary. This population was used for the effectiveness endpoints reporting.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of First Dose no Response
outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
outcome.population: Patients who took second IndoProCaf dose at 2 hours post-dose

group.title: Primary Headaches
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of First Dose no Response
measure.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
measure.population: Patients who took second IndoProCaf dose at 2 hours post-dose

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of Headache Relapse
outcome.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
outcome.population: Patients who had headache relapse. Headache relapse was defined as a worsening of headache attack after 24 hours of the initial dosing and pain-free at 2h but no later than 48 hours of initial IndoProCaf dosing.

group.title: Primary Headaches
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

measure.title: Percentage of Patients With Significant Pain Reduction in Case of Headache Relapse
measure.description: significant pain reduction defined as improvement to mild or no pain 2 hours post-dose by 4-point pain severity scale: 0 = no pain; 1 = mild headache, allowing normal activities; 2 = moderate headache, disturbing normal activities; 3 = severe headache, disabling activities, requiring bed-rest
measure.population: Patients who had headache relapse. Headache relapse was defined as a worsening of headache attack after 24 hours of the initial dosing and pain-free at 2h but no later than 48 hours of initial IndoProCaf dosing.

outcome.title: Percentage of Patients Who Are Satisfied With Different Medicines Previously Used for Headache Attack
outcome.description: Defined as good and very good by Likert-type scale (e.g. very poor, poor, no opinion, good, very good)
outcome.population: Patients who took trip tans in the past (data are from Safety set which included all enrolled patients who have taken at least one dose of IndoProCaf).

group.title: Patients With Primary Headaches and Took Triptans in the Past
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice who took triptans in the past.

group.title: Patients With Primary Headaches Who Took NSAIDs and Analgesics
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and who took NSAIDs and analgesics

group.title: Patients Who Took Combined Analgesics
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and who took combined analgesics in the past

group.title: Patients Who Took Ergotamine-based Drugs
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and who took ergotamine-based drugs in the past

group.title: Patients Who Took Antiemetics
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and who took antiemetics in the past

group.title: Patients Who Took Opioid Analgesics
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice and who took opioid analgesics in the past

measure.title: Percentage of Patients Who Are Satisfied With Different Medicines Previously Used for Headache Attack
measure.description: Defined as good and very good by Likert-type scale (e.g. very poor, poor, no opinion, good, very good)
measure.population: Patients who took trip tans in the past (data are from Safety set which included all enrolled patients who have taken at least one dose of IndoProCaf).

reported_events.desc: Overall 33 Adverse Events (AEs) were reported in 19 (2.7%) patients who participated in this study. Three (3) events were serious. There were no AEs that exceeded 5% frequency threshold. The most frequent (AEs) by System Organ Class (SOC) were gastrointestinal disorders and nervous system disorders, 9 AEs in 7 (1%) patients were reported in each of these groups.

group.title: Primary Headaches
group.description: Adults taking IndoProCaf for acute treatment of their primary headache attacks (migraine and/or episodic tension-type headache) as per routine clinical practice

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: The only disclosure restriction on the PI is that the sponsor can review results communications prior to public release and can embargo communications regarding trial results for a period that is less than or equal to 60 days. The sponsor cannot require changes to the communication and cannot extend the embargo.

point_of_contact.name_or_title: Jean-Pascal Berrou, Global Medical Director CNS/Pain
